importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date when the article was published, marking the moment the Toronto Blue Jays earned their place in the World Series after defeating the Seattle Mariners in Game 7 of the ALCS.
The scheduled start date of Game 1 of the World Series, indicating when fans and baseball enthusiasts worldwide will begin following the championship matchup between the Blue Jays and Dodgers.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timeframe during which the Toronto Blue Jays transitioned from a last-place finish in 2024 to a 94-68 record in 2025, highlighting their dramatic improvement and rise to the ALCS.
The period during which the Dodgers experienced late-season struggles, including bullpen collapses and a September sweep by the Pirates, which contrasted with their postseason dominance.
The timeframe of the ALCS and NLCS matchups, where the Dodgers' success and the Blue Jays' comeback were decided, culminating in the World Series.

keyTakeAways: The Toronto Blue Jays have made a historic comeback to the World Series after defeating the Seattle Mariners in seven games, marking their first appearance since 1993.
The Los Angeles Dodgers, with the largest payroll and recent dominance, are poised to become the first franchise in 25 years to win back-to-back World Series titles.

Shohei Ohtani delivered a legendary performance in Game 4 of the NLCS, recording three home runs and a 6.1-inning shutout with 10 strikeouts, a feat widely considered one of the greatest individual games in baseball history.
The Blue Jays' success in the ALCS — including 34 runs over four games against the Yankees — shows their offensive strength, though they narrowly lost to the Mariners in a close, seven-game series.
The Blue Jays face a significant defensive and pitching challenge from the Dodgers, who have outperformed opponents in the postseason despite a weak bullpen during the regular season.
The World Series begins on October 24, 2025, in Toronto, with the Blue Jays hosting the Dodgers in a pivotal matchup of two top-tier franchises.

namedEntities.name: Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Toronto, Canada.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Blue Jays are the team that has just won the ALCS and are now headed to the World Series, marking a significant milestone after 32 years.

namedEntities.name: Los Angeles Dodgers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Los Angeles, California.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Dodgers are the defending World Series contenders and the primary opponent in the upcoming World Series, with a history of success and a strong postseason performance.

namedEntities.name: Seattle Mariners
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Seattle, Washington.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Mariners were the ALCS opponent of the Blue Jays, and their failure to win the series despite strong performances highlights the Blue Jays’ resilience and the significance of the series outcome.

namedEntities.name: Shohei Ohtani
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A two-way star player for the Los Angeles Dodgers, known for both hitting and pitching.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Ohtani delivered a historic performance in the NLCS, including three home runs and a 6.1-inning shutout, which is central to the narrative of the Dodgers' postseason success.

namedEntities.name: Jeff Hoffman
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A pitcher for the Toronto Blue Jays, who participated in the ALCS and later spoke in a post-game interview.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Hoffman’s commentary after Game 7 reflects the Blue Jays' emotional and strategic persistence, providing insight into how they overcame adversity.

namedEntities.name: George Springer
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A key offensive player for the Toronto Blue Jays, who hit a game-winning home run in Game 7 of the ALCS.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Springer’s late-inning home run in Game 7 ended the Mariners’ hopes and was pivotal in the Blue Jays’ series win.

namedEntities.name: American League Championship Series (ALCS)
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The playoff series that determines the American League representative to the World Series.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The ALCS is where the Blue Jays defeated the Mariners and advanced to the World Series, highlighting the structure of MLB postseason play.

namedEntities.name: National League Championship Series (NLCS)
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The playoff series that determines the National League representative to the World Series.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Dodgers defeated the Milwaukee Brewers in the NLCS, showing their postseason dominance and setting up the World Series matchup.

namedEntities.name: World Series
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The championship series of Major League Baseball, pitting the AL and NL champions against each other.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The article centers on the upcoming World Series between the Blue Jays and Dodgers, emphasizing its significance as a historic and high-stakes event.

namedEntities.name: Philadelphia Phillies
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Phillies were defeated by the Dodgers in the NLDS, showcasing the Dodgers' strength in the postseason.

namedEntities.name: Milwaukee Brewers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Milwaukee, Wisconsin.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Brewers were swept by the Dodgers in the NLCS, indicating the Dodgers’ dominance in postseason play.

namedEntities.name: Pittsburgh Pirates
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball team based in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Pirates defeated the Dodgers in a September sweep during the regular season, highlighting the Dodgers’ regular-season struggles despite postseason success.

namedEntities.name: Fox (network)
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A television network that aired a post-game interview with Toronto Blue Jays pitcher Jeff Hoffman.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Fox provided a platform for post-series commentary, allowing fans to hear from key players and officials.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The Toronto Blue Jays have advanced to the World Series for the first time since 1993 by defeating the Seattle Mariners in a seven-game ALCS, overcoming a strong Mariners team that had a 2-0 series lead. The Blue Jays' dramatic turnaround from a last-place finish in 2024 to a 94-68 record in 2025, along with their 34-run performance against the Yankees in the ALDS, underscores their rise. However, they narrowly avoided elimination in the ALCS due to critical errors and a late-game home run by George Springer. Meanwhile, the Los Angeles Dodgers, with the largest payroll and a dominant postseason run — including a legendary performance by Shohei Ohtani — are the defending champions and poised to become the first team in 25 years to win back-to-back titles. The Blue Jays face a significant challenge in the World Series, especially in the bullpen, while the Dodgers are known for superior pitching and defense. The series begins on October 24, 2025, in Toronto, marking a pivotal moment in baseball history.
title: Blue Jays Advance to World Series After ALCS Victory Over Mariners; Dodgers Remain Strongest Contender
